intro: Priva portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican privet, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It is a member of the Oleaceae family, which includes other well-known species such as lilac and jasmine. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in racemes. Priva portoricensis plays a role in local ecosystems but is also considered an invasive species in some regions outside its native habitat.
